title: Heuristic Internet Information Literacy Curriculum for Medical Students

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Terminology and English Reading Proficiency (A1-A2 Level)
context.additional_context: Focuses on enhancing the ability to analyze real medical-related online resources, targeting first- and second-year medical students at beginner-intermediate English proficiency levels.

learning_goals: Participants can apply a heuristic framework to systematically evaluate English-language medical internet resources.
Participants perform a 5-step verification process to identify reliable medical information sources with 80% accuracy.
Participants develop critical thinking skills to analyze bias in online information through peer assessment and feedback.

resources: Access to a medical English online database
MS Excel and SPSS analysis tools

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
